messages.content: 9-1-1, what's your emergency?
It's about a quarter mile west of Castleton on the railroad tracks. We've got a train that derailed and there's a fire.
Okay, a quarter mile west of where?
West of Castleton, near the ethanol plant.
Okay, let me look on the map to get a better location. You said it's by the ethanol plant?
Yes, just between Castleton and the ethanol plant on the railroad track.
And you said a quarter mile west of Castleton?
Yes.
Is there a fire?
Yeah, there's fire and there's engineers trying to get out of the train right now. I'm heading that way.
Do you know how many cars derailed?
I can't tell you at this time. All I know is there's a lot of smoke.
Do you know what was in the cars?
It looks like grain cars.
Do you know how many people are still in the train?
There's probably three guys in the train. I heard them on the radio. They were trying to get out. I'm not sure if they managed to yet.
Alright, we have help on the way. If you get on the scene and have any updates for us, just give us a call back, okay?
Okay, thanks.
Thanks. Bye-bye.
9-1-1, what's your emergency?
There's a train derailment near Castleton. Are you aware of it?
Yes, we’ve got help on the way.
Alright, thank you. Bye.
Thanks. Bye-bye.
9-1-1, what's your emergency?
I'm calling to report a train derailment.
We’ve received multiple calls on this. Thank you.
Can you see what's going on?
Yeah, the flames are shooting up pretty high.
Alright, hold on a second, please.
9-1-1, what's the address of the emergency?
I don't know the exact address, but it's near Castleton.
Are you involved in this at all?
Yes, I'm part of the train crew.
Do you know if anybody's injured?
Nobody's injured at this point that we know of.
And what do you have on board?
Ethanol. It's a loaded ethanol and an empty ethanol train.
How many cars are derailed?
I can't tell how many cars for sure, but there's one ruptured car.
Alright, we do have people on the way. Make sure everyone keeps leaving the scene.
Everyone's walking away, yep.
Thank you.
Bye.
9-1-1, what's your emergency?
I'm near Castleton and there's a huge fire on the railroad track.
We do have that reported and help is on the way.
Okay, thank you. Bye.
Bye.
9-1-1, what's your emergency?
Hi, I'm near Castleton. I see huge black smoke. I don’t know if a house is on fire or what.
We're aware that it's a train derailment with a fire. Please stay out of the area.
I'm sorry, I just saw it out my window and wasn't sure if it was reported.
That's okay. Thank you.
Okay, bye.
Bye.
9-1-1, what's your emergency?
I'm calling about the train that's on fire near Castleton. I'm part of the train crew.
Is there a contact on site?
Yes, we're in position here. If we get the okay from someone, we can make a cut on the train and pull part of it away.
Hold on for just a second.
